doc:div.p: This page describes our Debian repository and available RabbitMQ Debian packages.

doc:section.name: apt
doc:section.doc:heading: Debian APT repository
doc:section.p: To make use of our APT repository,

ol.li: Add the following line to your /etc/apt/sources.list: deb http://www.rabbitmq.com/debian/ testing main (Please note that the word testing in this line refers to the state of our release of RabbitMQ, not any particular Debian distribution. You can use it with Debian stable, testing or unstable, as well as with Ubuntu. In the future we will have a stable release too.)

(optional) To avoid warnings about unsigned packages, add our public key to your trusted key list using apt-key(8):
wget http://www.rabbitmq.com/rabbitmq-signing-key-public.asc sudo apt-key add rabbitmq-signing-key-public.asc

Install packages as usual; for instance,
sudo apt-get install rabbitmq-server
